channel.title: Comments on: Revert to a Previous Version in Subversion

item.title: By: Shady Kahaleh
item.dc:creator: Shady Kahaleh
item.description: what if u want to revert one file?
item.content:encoded: what if u want to revert one file?

item.title: By: pacman
item.dc:creator: pacman
item.description: Awesome! Thanks! This was really helpful. I was missing the pointer to the current directory (.). All other websites were pointing to the directory of the trunk.
item.content:encoded: Awesome! Thanks! This was really helpful. I was missing the pointer to the current directory (.). All other websites were pointing to the directory of the trunk.

item.title: By: mc
item.dc:creator: mc
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/01/05/revert-to-a-previous-version-in-subversion/#comment-3156">Lloyd Budd</a>.
A little correction to the command:
svn merge -cr -[rev] .
if you use -c switch, you should not use -r switch, because
given 12345 is a previous revision number,
svn merge -r HEAD:12345
is equal to use the following command:
svn merge -c -12345
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lloyd Budd.

A little correction to the command:

svn merge -cr -[rev] .

if you use -c switch, you should not use -r switch, because

given 12345 is a previous revision number,

svn merge -r HEAD:12345

is equal to use the following command:

svn merge -c -12345

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/01/05/revert-to-a-previous-version-in-subversion/#comment-3156">Lloyd Budd</a>.
Nice tip, thanks.

item.title: By: Lloyd Budd
item.dc:creator: Lloyd Budd
item.description:
Most often I'm cherry picking reverting a specific revision to see if that resolves the issue:
<code>svn merge -cr -[rev] .<code>
item.content:encoded:
Most often I’m cherry picking reverting a specific revision to see if that resolves the issue:

svn merge -cr -[rev] .
